TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Unless there's something else next to it to reflect off?

*cough* OM *cough*
Are you going to try all of those crazy variants again?

Huh? What tweaks are you looking for? I think I have a few updates I could push that fix a few minor things

Enabling the British rocket parts (in particular the Blue Streak parts) to be sized up past 1.875m

Where can i find the "lattice style" decoupler for the Tantares Soyuz Decent and Instrument Module that I keep seeing in pictures? The one that is in the Tantares parts pack is a solid one that is flush with the hull.

Where can i find the "lattice style" decoupler for the Tantares Soyuz Decent and Instrument Module that I keep seeing in pictures? The one that is in the Tantares parts pack is a solid one that is flush with the hull.

The "lattice style" decoupler is a part of the "Nova Punch" mod.

Where can i find the "lattice style" decoupler for the Tantares Soyuz Decent and Instrument Module that I keep seeing in pictures? The one that is in the Tantares parts pack is a solid one that is flush with the hull.

It's no longer available. The current decoupler between the Soyuz SM and CM replicates the TM and TMA variants of the Soyuz where the lattice structure is covered by thermal fabric, though, *hint hint*, it would be nice to see an alternate decoupler with a lattice structure.

Enabling the British rocket parts (in particular the Blue Streak parts) to be sized up past 1.875m

Blue Streak/Europa is 1.73m in KSP, so 1.875m is a close enough approximation, so I don't plan on making it scaleable to a large size. I don't want to break career too much.

Black Arrow is actually too large in Tantares. It should be around 1.25m. I've included configs to make it smaller, but not larger.

Any specific reason you think those parts should be allowed to scale to 2.5m?

It's no longer available. The current decoupler between the Soyuz SM and CM replicates the TM and TMA variants of the Soyuz where the lattice structure is covered by thermal fabric, though, *hint hint*, it would be nice to see an alternate decoupler with a lattice structure.

Blue Streak/Europa is 1.73m in KSP, so 1.875m is a close enough approximation, so I don't plan on making it scaleable to a large size. I don't want to break career too much.

Black Arrow is actually too large in Tantares. It should be around 1.25m. I've included configs to make it smaller, but not larger.

Any specific reason you think those parts should be allowed to scale to 2.5m?

Blue Streak/Europa and Ariane I - 44 ... is a close enough approximation ...

Imagine yourself inside that capsule. You're undergoing reentry after something went wrong, your trajectory is much steeper than it should be. You might not survive.

And that picture is there looking at you.
Will the Fuji's Orbital Module have a picture of N1-Chan?

Imagine yourself inside that capsule. You're undergoing reentry after something went wrong, your trajectory is much steeper than it should be. You might not survive.

And that picture is there looking at you.

That's rather beautiful.

But, really, thank you for that chuckle.

WE RIDE TOGETHER TO BREADHALLA, FLUFFY AND WHOLEMEAL

Will the Fuji's Orbital Module have a picture of N1-Chan?

Now every time I play KSP, she'll see your face

It still needs a little polish, and it currently has a lot of dependencies, so I'll be making another with no dependencies at the cost of accuracy.

@Beale, with the IVA, can you cram the IVA space full of props? I've always liked really cluttered IVAs. Very immersive.

Also, will you actually be able to see out of the hatch? I don't envy the task of setting up the Fuji IVA, heh.

Edited October 27, 2015 by curtquarquesso

I have one question, A little thing thats been bugging me, What decoupler do you use for detaching the descent module of the soyuz from the habitation module? The best decoupler i can find for it isn't even a decoupler, it's a docking port with a built-in parachute.

I have one question, A little thing thats been bugging me, What decoupler do you use for detaching the descent module of the soyuz from the habitation module? The best decoupler i can find for it isn't even a decoupler, it's a docking port with a built-in parachute.

If we're both thinking of the same decoupler, you have it right. The decoupler used between the OM and DM also has a built in parachute.

I second the motion for cluttered IVAs. There aren't very many interiors in this mod anyway, so when we do get one, we like it to be as nice as possible.

If we're both thinking of the same decoupler, you have it right. The decoupler used between the OM and DM also has a built in parachute.

I second the motion for cluttered IVAs. There aren't very many interiors in this mod anyway, so when we do get one, we like it to be as nice as possible.

No, I mean a DECOUPLER, I'm using a docking port for it, But i've seen in the videos a seamless decouple, i've tried action groups for that and it didn't work, Luckily i've been able to dig up some tweakscale configs, and i'll just have to make do.

I have one question, A little thing thats been bugging me, What decoupler do you use for detaching the descent module of the soyuz from the habitation module? The best decoupler i can find for it isn't even a decoupler, it's a docking port with a built-in parachute.

You want the Tantares parachute part T037A Return Parachute, which is both a decoupler and parachute.
